title: Library Include Stores Absolute Path Instead of Relative Path
description: When creating library includes in the report design, the software is currently storing the absolute path. It should store the relative path instead to ensure portability and flexibility.
OB: In the report design, I noticed that the library include is storing the absolute path, like this: <property name='fileName' value='E:/birt/sampleReports/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary'/>. This is not ideal as it makes the report less portable and flexible.
EB: The expected behavior is that the library include should store the relative path, like this: <property name='fileName' value='lib1.rptlibrary'/>. Storing the relative path will ensure that the report can be easily moved to different directories or systems without breaking the references.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the report design in the software.
2. Add a library include to the report.
3. Observe that the software stores the absolute path in the 'fileName' property instead of the relative path.
